translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چهره در هم کشید و روی گردانید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روى را ترش كرد و سر برگردانيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: رو ترش كرد و رخ برتافت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چهره در هم كشيد و روى گردانيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: عبوس و ترشرو گشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چهره در هم کشید و روی برتافت! [[«عَبَسَ»: چهره در هم کشید. اخم و تخم کرد. مخاطب پیغمبر است. بدان گاه که سران قریش در خدمتش بودند و امیدوار بود که دعوتش را بپذیرند و با اسلام ایشان، قبائل و مردمان زیادی آئین یکتاپرستی را پذیرا گردند، مسلمان نابینای صادق و صمیمی و عاشق دینداری، و راغب فهم علم و دانش آسمانی، به نام ابن ام‌مکتوم به مجلس درآمد و با صدای بلند مکرّراً از آن حضرت تقاضای درس و وعظ قرآن و احکام دین کرد. اثر ناخوشنودی در چهره مبارکش پدیدار شد و از او روی گرداند و سرگرم ادامه دعوت اشراف به سوی دین خدا گردید. لذا مورد خطاب و عتاب آفریدگار قرار گرفت، و این مسأله، درس عبرت جاویدانی برای مسلمانان شد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ترشرویی کرد و روی بر تافت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چهره در هم کشید و روی برتافت...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روی درهم کشید و پشت کرد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روى در هم كشيد و رخ برتافت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (ای پیمبر خوش‌خو! آن تندخو) چهره در هم کشید، و روی گردانید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: HE FROWNED AND turned away,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He frowned and turned away.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He frowned and turned away.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (The Prophet (Peace be upon him)) frowned and turned away,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He frowned and turned away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He frowned and turned away.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The Prophet frowned and turned away

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He frowned and then turned away

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He frowned and turned (his) back,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAabasa watawall<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He frowned and turned away

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (The Prophet) frowned and turned away,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از اینکه آن مرد نابینا نزد او آمد!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آن نابينا به نزدش آمد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه آن نابينا نزد وى آمد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه آن مرد نابينا پيش او آمد؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون آن مرد نابینا حضورش آمد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از این که نابینائی به پیش او آمد. [[«أَن جَآءَهُ الأعْمی»: مفعولٌ‌له است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از اینکه آن نابینا به نزد او آمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از اینکه نابینایی به سراغ او آمده بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که آمدش کور

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چون آن نابينا به سويش آمد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (هنگامی) که (آن) مرد نابینا سویش آمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Because a blind man came to him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Because the blind man had come in his august presence.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that the blind man came to him.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Because there came Unto him a blind man.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Because there came to him the blind man (i.e. 'Abdullah bin Umm-Maktum, who came to the Prophet (Peace be upon him) while he was preaching to one or some of the Quraish chiefs).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When the blind man approached him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that the blind man came to him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Because there came to him the blind man.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Because the blind man came unto him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when the blind man approached him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: when the blind came to him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Because there came to him the blind man, [interrupting].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: from a blind man who had come up to him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Because there came to him the blind man.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: An j<u>a</u>ahu alaAAm<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when the blind man approached him,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Because there came to him the blind man (interrupting).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تو چه می دانی شاید او [در پرتو تعالیم اسلام از آلودگی] پاک و پاکیزه شود

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تو چه دانى، شايد كه او پاكيزه شود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و تو چه دانى؟ شايد او پاك شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و تو چه دانى، شايد او به پاكى گرايد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تو چه می‌دانی ممکن است او مردی پارسا و پاکیزه صفات باشد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو چه می‌دانی، شاید او (از آموزش و پرورش تو بهره گیرد و) خود را پاک و آراسته سازد. [[«مَا یُدْرِیکَ»: تو چه می‌دانی؟ (نگا: احزاب / 63، شوری / 17).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو چه دانی چه بسا او پاکدلی ورزد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تو چه می‌دانی شاید او پاکی و تقوا پیشه کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و چه دانستت شاید او پاکی جوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و تو چه دانى شايد او به پاكى گرايد- به سبب آنچه شنود-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تو را (ای بدخو) چه می‌فهماند؟ شاید (هم) او به پاکی گراید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What made you think that he will not grow in virtue,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And what do you know, he may be of the pure!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And what should teach thee? Perchance he would cleanse him,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: How canst thou know, whether haply he might be cleansed,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But what could tell you that per chance he might become pure (from sins)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But how do you know? Perhaps he was seeking to purify himself.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: How could you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And how can you know that he might become pure

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: What could inform thee but that he might grow (in grace)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And how do you know, maybe he would purify himself,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And what could let you know? Perhaps he (comes to hear you) to be purified.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But what would make you perceive, [O Muhammad], that perhaps he might be purified

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You never know. Perhaps he wanted to purify himself,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And what would make you know that he would purify himself,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wam<u>a</u> yudreeka laAAallahu yazzakk<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: for how can you know that he might seek to purify himself,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But what could tell thee but that perchance he might grow (in spiritual understanding)?-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا متذکّر [حقایق] گردد و آن تذکر او را سود دهد؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا پند گيرد و پند تو سودمندش افتد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا پند گيرد و آن پند سودش دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا پند پذيرد و اندرز سودش دهد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا (به تعلیم رسول) به یاد خدا آید و ذکر حق او را سودمند افتد. (مراد عبد اللّه مکتوم است که چون حضور رسول برای تعلیم قرآن آمد جمعی از اکابر کفار قریش نزد حضرت بودند، حضرت از حرص بر ایمان و هدایت آنها به او توجه کامل نکرد و به صحبت مشغول بود و مرد متشخصی از امویان بر آن نابینا ترشرویی و اظهار انزجار نمود. بر نکوهش او و حرمت عبد اللّه این آیات نازل شد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که پند گیرد و اندرز بدو سود برساند. [[«یَذَّکَّرُ»: متّعظ شود. پندپذیر گردد. «فَتَنفَعَهُ»: فعل (تَنفَعَ) منصوب به (أَنْ) مقدّر بعد از فاء سببیّه است و جواب (لَعَلَّ) است (نگا: غافر / 37). «الذِّکْری»: (نگا: انعام / 69 و 90، اعراف / 2، هود / 114 و 120).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا پندگیرد و پندش سود بخشد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا متذکّر گردد و این تذکّر به حال او مفید باشد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا یادآور شود پس سود دهدش یادآوردن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا پند گيرد و آن پند سودش دهد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا یاد پذیرد، پس یادواره سودش دهد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or be admonished, and the admonition profit him?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or that he may accept advice, so the advice may benefit him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: or yet remember, and the Reminder profit him.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or be admonished, so that the admonition might have profited him?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or that he might receive admonition, and that the admonition might profit him?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or be reminded, and the message would benefit him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: or he might be mindful and good counsel might avail him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or he might receive admonition, and the admonition might profit him

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or take heed and so the reminder might avail him?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: or take admonition, and the admonition would benefit him!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (He might) remember, and the Reminder might profit him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: or receive some (Quranic) advice which would benefit him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or become reminded so that the reminder should profit him?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aw yaththakkaru fatanfaAAahu alththikra

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: or take heed and derive benefit from [Our] warning?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or that he might receive admonition, and the teaching might profit him?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اما کسی که خود را ثروتمند نشان می دهد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما آن كه او توانگر است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اما آن كه [از پند تو] اظهار بى‌نيازى مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اما آن كس كه خود را بى‌نياز مى‌پندارد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما آن که دارا (و مغرور دنیا) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا آن کس که خود را (از دین و هدایت آسمانی) بی‌نیاز می‌داند. [[«إسْتَغْنی»: خود را بی‌نیاز می‌بیند از چیزی که با خود آورده‌ای، و به ثروت و قدرت دنیوی بسنده می‌کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اما کسی که بی‌نیازی نشان می‌دهد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا آن کس که توانگر است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اما آنکه بی‌نیازی جست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اما آن كه بى‌نياز است- به مال و جاه-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: اما کسی که خود را بی‌نیاز پندارد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: As for him who is not in want of any thing,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For him who does not care,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But the self-sufficient,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: As for him who regardeth himself self-sufficient-

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But as for him who was indifferent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Now he who waxes indifferent,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: As for him who thinketh himself independent,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But as for someone who is wealthy,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for he who is sufficed

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: As for he who thinks himself without need,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Yet you pay attention

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: As for him who considers himself free from need (of you),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Amm<u>a</u> mani istaghn<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: As for him who was indifferent,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: As to one who regards Himself as self-sufficient,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تو به او روی می آوری [و نسبت به وی اهتمام می ورزی]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تو روى خود بدو مى‌كنى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس تو به او مى‌پردازى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تو بدو مى‌پردازى؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو به او توجه کنی (و حریص بر ایمان او باشی).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو بدو روی می‌آوری و می‌پردازی! [[«تَصَدّی»: رو می‌کنی. فعل مضارع است و در اصل (تَتَصَدّی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [چرا] تو به او می‌پردازی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تو به او روی می‌آوری،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس تواش پذیرفتی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس تو بدو روى مى‌آرى و به او مى‌پردازى!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس تو برایش بانگی لطیف و پربرگ‌وساز می‌نوازی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You pay full attention,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So you are after him!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: to him thou attendest

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto him thou attendest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: To him you attend;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You gave him your attention.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: you attend to him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: To him you attend;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Unto him thou payest regard.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: you attend to him,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: you attended to him,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To him you give attention.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: to a rich man,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: To him do you address yourself.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faanta lahu ta<u>s</u>add<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you eagerly attended to him --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To him dost thou attend;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که اگر او نخواهد خود را [از آلودگی های باطنی و عملی] پاک کند تکلیفی بر عهده تو [نسبت به او] نیست؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اگر هم پاك نگردد چيزى بر عهده تو نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر هم پاك نشود، گناهى بر تو نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: با آنكه اگر پاك نگردد، بر تو [مسؤوليتى‌] نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که اگر او به پارسایی نپردازد بر تو تکلیفی نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چه گناهی بر تو است اگر او (با آب ایمان، از چرک کفر) خویشتن را پاک و پاکیزه ندارد؟! [[«وَ مَا عَلَیْکَ»: در حالی که گناهی بر تو نیست. چه گناهی بر تو است؟ حرف واو حالیّه یا عاطفه است. واژه (مَا) نافیه یا استفهامیّه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر هم پاکدلی پیشه نکند، ایرادی بر تو نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در حالی که اگر او خود را پاک نسازد، چیزی بر تو نیست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست بر تو که او پاکی نجوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چيست بر تو- تو را چه زيان دارد- كه [آن كافر] پاكى نورزد؟- يا: و تو را باكى نيست كه او پاكى نمى‌ورزد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چیزی (هم) بر تو نیست که خود را پاک نگرداند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Though it is not your concern if he should not grow (in fulness).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And you have nothing to lose if he does not become pure.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: though it is not thy concern, if he does not cleanse himself.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Whereas it is not on thee that he is not cleansed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: What does it matter to you if he will not become pure (from disbelief, you are only a Messenger, your duty is to convey the Message of Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Though you are not liable if he does not purify himself.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: though you are not to blame if he would not cleanse himself.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: What does it matter to you if he will not become pure

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Yet it is not thy concern if he grow not (in grace).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: though you are not liable if he does not purify himself.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: although it is not for you to be concerned if he remained unpurified.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: though you will not be questioned even if he never purifies himself.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And no blame is on you if he would not purify himself

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wam<u>a</u> AAalayka all<u>a</u> yazzakk<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: though you are not to be blamed if he would not purify himself --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Though it is no blame to thee if he grow not (in spiritual understanding).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما آنکه شتابان نزد تو آمد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اما آن كه دوان‌دوان به نزد تو مى‌آيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آن كه شتابان به سويت آمده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما آن كس كه شتابان پيش تو آمد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما آن کس که (چون عبد اللّه مکتوم به شوق دل برای ذکر خدا) به سوی تو می‌شتابد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا کسی که شتابان و مشتاقانه به پیش تو می‌آید. [[«یَسْعی»: به تلاش می‌ایستد، با علاقه می‌آید. حال فاعل (جَآءَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما کسی که شتابان به سویت آمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسی که به سراغ تو می‌آید و کوشش می‌کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما آنکه بیامدت می‌دوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما آن كه با كوشش و شتاب نزد تو آمده،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اما آن کس که شتابان نزدت آمد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: As for him who comes to you striving (after goodness),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And for him who came to you striving,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he who comes to thee eagerly

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for him who cometh Unto thee running,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But as to him who came to you running.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But as for him who came to you seeking.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But he who comes to you running,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But as for him who came to you running,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But as for him who cometh unto thee with earnest purpose

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But as for someone who comes hurrying to you,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And to him who came to you eagerly

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: As for the one who comes to you earnestly (striving for guidance).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as to him who comes to you striving hard,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamm<u>a</u> man j<u>a</u>aka yasAA<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but as for one who comes to you, eagerly

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But as to him who came to thee striving earnestly,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که [از پروردگارش] می ترسد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و مى‌ترسد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در حالى كه از خدا مى‌ترسد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حالى كه [از خدا] مى‌ترسيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و او مرد خدا ترس و با تقوایی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و از خدا ترسان است. [[«وَ»: واو حالیّه است، و (هُوَ یَخْشی) حال فاعل (جَآءَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او خشیت می‌ورزد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از خدا ترسان است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و او می‌ترسید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در حالى كه [از خداى‌] مى‌ترسد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در حالی‌که (از خدا) می‌هراسد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And is also fearful (of God),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And whereas he fears,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and fearfully,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he feareth'-

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And is afraid (of Allah and His Punishment),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In awe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and fears (Allah),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And is afraid.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And hath fear,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: while he fears [Allah],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and fearfully,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: While he fears [Allah],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and who has fear of God,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he fears,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wahuwa yakhsh<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and in awe of God

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And with fear (in his heart),

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تو [با روی گردانی] از او به دیگران می پردازی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تو از او به ديگرى مى‌پردازى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس تو از او به ديگرى مى‌پردازى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تو از او به ديگران مى‌پردازى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو از توجه به او خود داری می‌کنی!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو از او غافل می‌شوی (و بدو اعتناء نمی‌کنی!). [[«تَلَهّی»: غافل می‌گردی. توجّه نمی‌کنی. فعل مضارع است. در اصل (تَتَلَهّی) بوده و در حقیقت نقطه مقابل (تَصَدّی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تو از او به دیگری می‌پردازی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تو از او غافل می‌شوی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس تو از او سرگرمی جستی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس تو از او [به ديگرى‌] مى‌پردازى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس تو از او -با بی‌‌اعتنایی- سهل‌انگاری می‌کنی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You neglect.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So you leave him, and are engrossed elsewhere!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: to him thou payest no heed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Him thou neglectest!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Of him you are neglectful and divert your attention to another,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: To him you were inattentive.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: you pay no heed to him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Of him you are neglectful and divert your attention to another.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: From him thou art distracted.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: you are neglectful of him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: of him you were unmindful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: From him you are distracted.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: you ignore him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: From him will you divert yourself.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faanta AAanhu talahh<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you pay him no heed.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Of him wast thou unmindful.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین [برخوردی شایسته] نیست، بی تردید این آیات قرآن مایه پند است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آرى، اين قرآن اندرزى است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چنين مپندار، كه اين [آيات‌] تذكارى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: زنهار [چنين مكن‌] اين [آيات‌] پندى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این روا نیست، که آیات حق برای پند و تذکر (همه خلق) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نباید چنین باشد! این آیات (قرآنی و شریعت آسمانی) یادآوری و آگاهی است و بس. [[«کلاّ»: نباید چنین کرد. حقّا. «اِنَّهَا»: این که آیات قرآنی. ضمیر (ها) به (آیات) برمی‌گردد. یا این که به قرآن برمی‌گردد و به خاطر تأنیث خبر، مؤنّث آمده است (نگا: آلوسی). «تَذْکِرَةٌ»: یادآوری کردن. بیدارباش و آگاهی دادن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین نیست، آن پندآموزی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز چنین نیست که آنها می‌پندارند؛ این (قرآن) تذکّر و یادآوری است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است همانا آن است یادآوریی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا اين [آيات قرآن‌] يادآورى و پندى است- براى آدميان-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: زنهار (چنان نیست!) این (آیات) همواره یادواره‌‌ای است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Assuredly this is a reminder

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Not this way – this is the advice.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No indeed; it is a Reminder

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! Verily it is an admonition.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, (do not do like this), indeed it (these Verses of this Quran) are an admonition,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do not. This is a Lesson.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: No indeed; this is only a Reminder.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay; indeed it is an admonition.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but verily it is an Admonishment,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No indeed! These [verses of the Quran ] are a reminder

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No indeed, this is a Reminder;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! Indeed, these verses are a reminder;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: These verses are a reminder

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! surely it is an admonishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla innaha tathkiratun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Indeed, this [Quran] is an admonition.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By no means (should it be so)! For it is indeed a Message of instruction:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هرکه خواست از آن پند گیرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس هر كه خواهد از آن پند گيرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس هر كه خواهد آن را ياد كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا هر كه خواهد، از آن پند گيرد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا هر که بخواهد پند گیرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس هر که خواهد از آن پند گیرد (و هرکه خواهد سرِ خویش گیرد). [[«ذَکَرَهُ»: از قرآن پند و اندرز گرفت. ضمیر (هُ) به قرآن برمی‌گردد که مشارٌالیه آیات است. بعضیها آن را به خدا برمی‌گردانند. در این صورت معنی چنین است: هرکه خواهد خدا را یاد کند و به یاد او باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هر که خواهد آن را یاد کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هر کس بخواهد از آن پند می‌گیرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که هر که خواهد یاد آوردش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس هر كه خواهد، آن را ياد كند و پند گيرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس هر کس بخواهد، آن را یاد کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For any one who desires to bear it in mind,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So whoever wishes may remember it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: (and whoso wills, shall remember it)

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So whosoever willeth-let him be admonished therewlth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So whoever wills, let him pay attention to it.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Whoever wills, shall remember it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So whoso wills may give heed to it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, whoever wills, let him pay attention to Him (it).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So let whosoever will pay heed to it,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —so let anyone who wishes remember—

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and whosoever wills, shall remember it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So whoever wills may remember it.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: so let those who want to follow its guidance do so.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So let him who pleases mind it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faman shaa thakarahu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Let him who will, pay heed to it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore let whoso will, keep it in remembrance.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در صحیفه هایی است ارزشمند

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در صحيفه‌هايى گرامى،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [كه‌] در صحيفه‌هايى ارجمند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در صحيفه‌هايى ارجمند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیات الهی در صحیفه‌هایی مکرّم (یعنی لوح محفوظ یا کتب آسمانی یا قلوب پاکان) نگاشته است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در نامه‌های گرامی و ارجمند ضبط و ثبت است. [[«صُحُفٍ»: جمع صَحیفه، نامه‌ها و کتابها. هرگونه برگه نوشته شده‌ای اعم از کاغذ و پوست و غیره. در اینجا مراد صفحات اذهان و نسخه‌های اوراق پراکنده‌ای است که آیات مبارک قرآن در آن حفظ و ضبط و ثبت می‌شده و بعدها به صورت کتاب جامع همه آیات درآمده که همین قرآن است، و پیوسته با خطها و شکل‌های متنوّع نگارش می‌یابد، و در روزگار ما گذشته از صفحات اذهان و اوراق، بر روی نوار و صفحه هوا و طول امواج ضبط و پخش می‌شود. «مُکَرَّمَةٍ»: گرامی. محترم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در میان صحیفه‌های ارجمند است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در الواح پرارزشی ثبت است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: در نامه‌هایی گرامی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [آنها] در دفترهايى است گرامى‌داشته،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در صحیفه‌هایی بس گرامی شده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Contained) in honoured pages,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: On honourable pages.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: upon pages high-honoured,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Inscribed in Writs honoured,"

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (It is) in Records held (greatly) in honour (Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz).

translations.name: Talal Itani

translations.text: سپس راه (خروج از نقص به کمال) را بر او سهل و آسان گردانید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس راه (شناخت خوبی و بدی) را برای او آسان می‌کند (تا راه هدایت را در پیش گیرد، و راه ضلالت را ترک گوید). [[«السَّبِیلَ»: راه تشخیص هدایت و ضلالت و خوبی و بدی (نگا: بلد / 10) در پرتو عقل و فکر و الهام و وحی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس راه را بر او آسان داشته است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس راه را برای او آسان کرد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس راه را آماده ساختش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس راه [به ايمان و طاعت‌] را برايش آسان ساخت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس او را فراسوی راه آسان گردانید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then made his passage easy (at birth);

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then eased the way for him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then the way eased for him,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the way He made easy.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then He makes the Path easy for him;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then He eased the way for him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then made the course of life easy for him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then He made the path easy for him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then maketh the way easy for him,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then He made the way easy for him;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then eased his path for him,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then He eased the way for him;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and made the path of guidance easy for him to follow.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then (as for) the way-- He has made it easy (for him)

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma alssabeela yassarahu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He makes his path easy for him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then doth He make His path smooth for him;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس او را میراند و در گور نهاد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه بميراندش و در گور كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس وى را بميراند و به گورش برد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه به مرگش رسانيد و در قبرش نهاد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه (به وقت معین) او را بمیراند و به خاک قبر سپرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بعد او را می‌میراند و وارد گورش می‌گرداند. [[«أمَاتَهُ»: او را می‌راند. «أَقْبَرَهُ»: وارد گورش گردانْد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس او را میرانید و او را در گور کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بعد او را میراند و در قبر پنهان نمود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس میرانیدش و به گور بردش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس او را بميرانيد و در گور كرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس میراندش، پس در گورش نهاد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He will then send him to death and have him laid in the grave.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then gave him death, so had him put in the grave.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then makes him to die, and buries him,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then He caused him to die and made him to be buried.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then He causes him to die, and puts him in his grave;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then He puts him to death, and buries him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: then He caused him to die and brought him to the grave,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then He causes him to die and puts him in his grave.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then causeth him to die, and burieth him;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: then He made him die and buried him;

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then causes him to die and buries him,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then He caused him to die and be buried

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then He causes him to die, then assigns to him a grave,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma amatahu faaqbarahu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then He causes him to die and be buried.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then He causeth him to die, and putteth him in his grave;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و سپس چون بخواهد او را زنده می کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنگاه كه خواهد زنده‌اش سازد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس هر وقت بخواهد زنده‌اش مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس چون بخواهد او را برانگيزد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و سپس هر وقت خواهد باز او را از قبر بر انگیزد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس هر وقت خواست او را زنده می‌گرداند. [[«أَنشَرَهُ»: زنده‌اش گرداند (نگا: انبیاء / 21، دخان / 35).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس هر زمان که خواست او را برانگیزد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس هرگاه بخواهد او را زنده می‌کند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس هر گاه خواست برون آردش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس آنگاه كه بخواهد او را برانگيزد- باز زنده گرداند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس هنگامی که بخواهد او را باز می‌گرداند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then He will raise him up again when He please.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then, when He willed, He brought him out. (As during the night of Holy Prophet’s ascension, when all the Prophets gathered behind him in the Al Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem. Or when Allah will raise everyone on the Day of Resurrection.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then, when He wills, He raises him.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when He listeth, He shall raise him to life.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, when it is His Will, He will resurrect him (again).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when He wills, He will resurrect him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then when it is His will, He will resurrect him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and then, when He wished, resurrected him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then, He will raise him when He wills.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and He will resurrect him whenever He wants.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then when He pleases, He will raise him to life again.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma itha shaa ansharahu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then when He pleases, He will bring him back to life.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین نیست [که وظیفه اش را انجام داده باشد] هنوز آنچه را به او دستور داده به جا نیاورده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، كه هنوز آنچه را به او فرمان داده بود به جاى نياورده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ولى نه! هنوز [انسان‌] آنچه را كه خدايش فرمان داده به جا نياورده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ولى نه! هنوز آنچه را به او دستور داده، به جاى نياورده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چنین نیست (که منکران معاد می‌پندارند) بشر کافر هنوز آنچه خدا امر کرده به جا نیاورده (تا سعادت ابد یابد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگزا هرگز! انسان (با وجود طول حیات) دستوری را که خدا بدو داده است (و وظائفی را که برای وی تعیین کرده است، آن چنان که شایسته‌ی مقام باعظمت الهی است) هنوز که هنوز است انجام نداده است! [[«کَلاّ»: حَقّا. هرگزا هرگز. این واژه می‌تواند معنی مشهور خود، یعنی (نه چنین است) داشته باشد. چرا که بسیاری از افراد کوتاه‌بینِ پرادّعاء چنین می‌پندارند که وظائف خود را در برابر خدا به انجام رسانیده‌اند ولی این آیه شریفه، اندیشه و گفته ایشان را نادرست می‌شمارد. «لَمَّا یَقْضِ»: هنوز انجام نداده است. تاکنون به وظیفه خود عمل نکرده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حاشا، او آنچه به او فرمان داده بود، انجام نداد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چنین نیست که او می‌پندارد؛ او هنوز آنچه را (خدا) فرمان داده، اطاعت نکرده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است هنوز نگذارد آنچه فرمودش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه چنين است كه هنوز آنچه را [خدا] به او فرمان داده نگزارده و بجاى نياورده است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نه چنان است‌! هنوز آنچه را به او دستور داده، انجام نداده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But no. He has not fulfilled what was enjoined on him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Not one – he has not yet completed what he was commanded.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No indeed! Man has not accomplished His bidding.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means He performed not that which He had commanded him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, but (man) has not done what He commanded him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But no, he did not fulfill what He has commanded him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nay, but man did not fulfil what Allah had enjoined upon him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, but has not done what He commanded him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but (man) hath not done what He commanded him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No indeed! He has not yet carried out what He has commanded him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, he has not fulfilled that which He has ordered him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! Man has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Certainly, he has not duly fulfilled His commands.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay; but he has not done what He bade him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla lamma yaqdi ma amarahu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Yet man declines to do His bidding.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By no means hath he fulfilled what Allah hath commanded him.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس انسان باید به خوراکش با تأمل بنگرد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس آدمى به طعام خود بنگرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آدمى بايد طعام خويش را بنگرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس انسان بايد به خوراك خود بنگرد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آدمی باید به قوت و غذای خود به چشم خود بنگرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: انسان باید به غذای خویش بنگرد و درباره‌ی آن بیندیشد (که چگونه ما آن را برای او فراهم کرده‌ایم، و در ساختمان مواد غذائی و اجزاء حیات‌بخش آن، چه دقّت و مهارت و ظرافتی به کار برده‌ایم). [[«فَلْیَنظُرْ»: باید که بنگرد. معلوم است که در اینجا نگریستن به معنی اندیشیدن و دقّت لازم به کار بردن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس باید انسان به خوراک خویش بنگرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: انسان باید به غذای خویش (و آفرینش آن) بنگرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بنگرد انسان بسوی خوراکش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آدمى بايد به خوراك خود بنگرد- تا عبرت گيرد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس انسان باید به خوراک (روح و تن) خود بنگرد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Let man therefore consider (the sources of) his food.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So man must look at his food.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Let Man consider his nourishment.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Let man look at his food:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then let man look at his food,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Let man consider his food.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So let man just consider his food:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then let man look at his food:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Let man consider his food:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Let man consider his food:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Let the human reflect on the food he eats,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then let mankind look at his food -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Let the human being think about (how We produce) his food.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then let man look to his food,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falyanthuri alinsanu ila taAAamihi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Let man reflect on the food he eats.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then let man look at his food, (and how We provide it):

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که ما [از آسمان] آب فراوانی فرو ریختیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما باران را فرو باريديم، باريدنى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به تحقيق ما آب فراوانى [از آسمان‌] فرو ريختيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه ما آب را به صورت بارشى فرو ريختيم؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که ما آب باران فرو ریختیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما آب را از آسمان به گونه‌ی شگفتی می‌بارانیم. [[«صَبَبْنَا»: فرو ریخته‌ایم. بارانده‌ایم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما آب را به فراوانی فرو ریخته‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما آب فراوان از آسمان فرو ریختیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که ریختیم ما آب را ریزشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا ما آب [باران‌] را فرو ريختيم فروريختنى

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که همانا ما آب را به صورت بارشی تند فرو ریختیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We poured down rain abundantly,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That We watered it in abundance.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We poured out the rains abundantly,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It is We Who pour forth water, pouring,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That We pour forth water in abundance,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We pour down water in abundance.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We poured water, pouring it in great abundance,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We pour forth water in abundance.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: How We pour water in showers

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We pour down plenteous water [from the sky],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: how We pour down rain in abundance,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: How We poured down water in torrents,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We send down abundant water,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That We pour down the water, pouring (it) down in abundance,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Anna sababna almaa sabban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We let the rain pour down in torrents

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For that We pour forth water in abundance,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس زمین را [به صورتی سودمند] از هم شکافتیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زمين را شكافتيم، شكافتنى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس زمين را از هم شكافتيم، شكافتنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه زمين را با شكافتنى [لازم‌] شكافتيم؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه خاک زمین بشکافتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس زمین را می‌شکافیم و از هم باز می‌کنیم. [[«شَقَقْنَا الأرْضَ»: شکافتن زمین. اشاره به قابلیّت خاکها و سنگها برای درز برداشتن و پذیرش هوا و نور و جوانه‌های گیاهان در خود، و روی هم رفته آماده زراعت گشتن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس زمین را به نیکی برشکافته‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس زمین را از هم شکافتیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس شکافتیم زمین را شکافتنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس زمين را [با سر برآوردن گياهان‌] بشكافتيم شكافتنى.

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و] آنها را تاريكى پوشانده است؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به رویشان خاک سیاه ذلّت و خجلت نشسته.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ابر تیره و سیاه (هراس و اندوه) آن رخسارها را می‌پوشاند. [[«قَتَرَةٌ»: ابر تیره و سیاه (نگا: المصحف المیسّر). دودگونه‌ای از هول و هراس و غم و اندوه، رخساره را می‌پوشاند (نگا: معجم‌الفاظ القرآن الکریم). همچنین (نگا: یونس / 26).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تیرگی آنها را فرو گیرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و دود تاریکی آنها را پوشانده است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دستخوش سازدش پریشانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تيرگى و سياهى آنها را فرو پوشد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و) آنها را تنگدستی و تنگی و خواری سخت پوشانده!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Covered with the blackness (of shame):

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Blackness overcoming them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: o'erspread with darkness --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Dust shall cover them

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Darkness will cover them,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Overwhelmed by remorse.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: enveloped by darkness.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Darkness will cover them.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Veiled in darkness,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: overcast with gloom.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and veiled with darkness.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Blackness will cover them.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and covered by darkness.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Darkness shall cover them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tarhaquha qataratun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and overcast with gloom:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Blackness will cover them:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان همان کافران بد کارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اينان كافران و فاجرانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنان همان كافران بدكارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنان همان كافران بدكارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنها همان کافران و بدکاران عالمند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان، کافران بزهکار و بدکردارند. [[«الْفَجَرَةُ»: جمع فاجِر، کسی که آشکارا به فسق و فجور دست می‌یازد، و بر ضدّ شرع می‌شورد (نگا: المصحف المیسّر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اینان همان کافرکیشان نافرمانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنان همان کافران فاجرند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنانند کافران پرده‌دران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اينانند كافران بدكار گنه‌پيشه.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ایشان، (هم)آنان کافران و فاجرانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will be the unbelievers, transgressors.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It is they, the disbelievers, the sinners.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: those -- they are the unbelievers, the libertines.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Those! they are the infidels, the ungodly.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Such will be the Kafarah (disbelievers in Allah, in His Oneness, and in His Messenger Muhammad (Peace be upon him), etc.), the Fajarah (wicked evil doers).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: These are the faithless, the vicious.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: These will be the unbelievers, the wicked.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Such will be the disbelieving, the wicked evil doers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is they who are the faithless, the vicious.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those, they are the unbelievers, the immoral.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: These will be the faces of the sinful disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: These are they who are unbelievers, the wicked.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Olaika humu alkafaratu alfajaratu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: those will be ones who denied the truth and were immersed in iniquity.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Such will be the Rejecters of Allah, the doers of iniquity.
